subtopic: Attentional blink in rapid serial presentation
main_point: The professor explains Attentional blink in rapid serial presentation and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes baseline (a process) from cognitive load (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving working memory and placebo.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a student misconception to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for reinforcement shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
